metadata.title: CVE-2019-6474 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A missing check on incoming client requests can be exploited to cause a situation where the Kea server's lease storage contains leases which are rejected as invalid when the server tries to load leases from storage on restart. If the number of such leases exceeds a hard-coded limit in the Kea code, a server trying to restart will conclude that there is a problem with its lease store and give up. Versions affected: 1.4.0 to 1.5.0, 1.6.0-beta1, and 1.6.0-beta2

notes.note: amurray> This only affects servers which are using memfile for lease storage.

criterions.comment: isc-kea package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
